page.title: 19Nibley Monument-W.Tyndale.
page.content: William Hutchings Tyndale was born in North Nibley in 1484.In memory of his achievements,there is a monument which stands on Nibley Knoll overlooking the village of Nibley.It was built by S.S.Teulon in 1866 and is of Victorian design.111ft high,26.5ft square.Inside there are stairs leading up to a gallery with enamel work by Salvaiti. An inscription on the monument reads "Erected A.D.1866 in grateful memory of William Tyndale,translator of the English Bible,who first caused the New Testament to be printed in the tongue of his native countrymen;born near this spot,he suffered martyrdom at Vilvord in Flanders on October 6th 1536." The monument is open to the public.The trustees of the Tyndale Monument Charity organised a sponsored walk and art sale to raise funds.
